title.narrative: WASH OP 2 - Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN HEALTH,NUTRITION,EDUCATIO

description.narrative: Community-level institutions improve the use of safe water, hand washing with soap and use of latrines by children and families though promotion of good hygiene practices and meeting of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) infrastructure standards., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2020, households and communities have access to safe drinking water, sanitation, and healthy environments and good hygiene practices are equitably improved in target regions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Community-level institutions improve the use of safe water, hand washing with soap and use of latrines by children and familiesthough promotion of good hygiene practices and meeting of WASH infrastructure standards.

description.narrative: Despite some progress in increasing access to WASH facilities, results in this Output were;constrained;in 2020,;first due to the suspension of cash advances to implementing line ministries, then due to school closures between March and October due to COVID-19.;However, training;was intensified in healthcare facilities (HCF) for staff,;patients,;and visitors. Implementation of Star Approach activities has restarted during this last quarter of 2020 in collaboration with new NGO partners.; | Status:Not met | As-of Date:14/01/2021
